summary.text:
**Evaluating citation requirements**

I see that I need to include citations, despite earlier messages not having them in the final output. The developer emphasized the need for citations and specified including them in summary_md or possibly adding a "citations" field, which isn’t typically in the schema. It’s crucial to adhere to the schema, but I think I'll append the citations anyway for clarity. Following instructions correctly is essential for the final JSON output.

**Planning summary structure**

I need to create a concise summary, keeping it under 200 words. I’ll include a one-line summary that should be less than 100 characters. My highlights will focus on pulling together 3 to 7 key strings. Additionally, I need to formulate 1 to 3 next questions. It’s important to maintain minimal verbosity throughout this process to keep the information clear and straightforward. Crafting effective content here is key! Let’s get started.

**Summarizing graph properties**

I need to highlight key facts about graph G, which is proven to be K4-free with maximal cliques forming facial triangles. There’s a link to an interior vertex chordless cycle, and I've noted that local Helly conditions for interior edges must include endpoints. The three-triangle lemma clarified that intersecting faces induce maximal cliques, while I corrected previous errors regarding T(v) sizes being maximal. Also, I verified properties related to fans and hexagons. Let's refine these points!

**Organizing open tasks**

I have open tasks to formalize the ear-removal induction for outerplanar triangulations, aiming to prove k-nullness. I also need to analyze k^2G behavior for general disk Whitney triangulations. The user specified a focus on 1 to 3 tasks, so I can choose to formalize ear-removal induction and run exhaustive computations on smaller triangulations to test k-nullness. I’ll craft a summary that highlights core achievements and identifies remaining gaps while ensuring it stays within 120-140 words. Let’s do this!

**Drafting final JSON**

I’m working on the final JSON output. My one-line summary needs to be concise: “Maximal cliques in kG classified as T(v) or N(t); k-nullness still open.” That’s about 70 characters. I’ll include six highlights, each as a concise string. For next questions, I’ll have three items focused on formalizing ear-removal induction, showing k-nullness for disk Whitney triangulations, or finding a counterexample, and running exhaustive computations. I’ll make sure to escape quotes and format everything correctly in the JSON. Let’s write it! 

{
  "summary_md": "This round proved local structure and completed a classification of maximal cliques in kG for finite Whitney triangulations of the disk. Global classification: every maximal clique of kG is either T(v) for some vertex v (vertex-star) or N(t) for some fully interior face t; proven via K4-freeness, chordless links, local Helly across interior edges, shared-edge classification, and the three-triangle lemma. Verified k-null for fans, two-triangle disks, and hexagon+central triangle. Corrections: size-3 T(v) can be maximal; outerplanar Helly claim retracted. Remaining gaps: outerplanar ear-removal induction to deduce k-nullness; analyze k-iterations (k^2G etc.) for general disks. Sources: Research Notes; Rigorous Proofs; Verifier Summary.",
  "one_line_summary": "Maximal cliques in kG classified as T(v) or N(t); k-nullness still open.",
  "highlights": ["Maximal cliques classified as T(v) or N(t).", "K4-freeness confirmed.", "Local Helly condition proven.", "Shared-edge classification established.", "Three-triangle lemma verified.", "Corrections on T(v) size-3 maximal."],
  "next_questions": ["Formalize ear-removal induction.", "Show k-nullness for all disk Whitney triangulations or find counterexample.", "Run exhaustive computation for n≤20 faces with interior deg 4–5."]
}

content.text: {"summary_md":"This round established the local combinatorial structure of finite Whitney triangulations of the disk and completed a classification of maximal cliques in kG. Key tools were K4-freeness, chordless interior links (deg≥4), a local Helly lemma across interior edges, a shared-edge clique classification, and a three-triangle lemma for no-edge-sharing families. Main conclusion: every maximal clique of kG is either a vertex-star T(v) or the 4-set N(t) arising from a fully interior face t (so ω(kG)=max_v|T(v)| or 4 if some fully interior face exists). Verified k-nullness in several small families (fans, two-triangle disk, hexagon+central triangle). Corrections: size-3 T(v) can be maximal; an earlier outerplanar Helly claim was false. Remaining work centers on proving global k-nullness (or finding counterexamples) by completing an ear-removal induction for outerplanar cases and analysing k-iterations computationally. Sources: Research Notes; Rigorous Proofs; Verifier Summary.","one_line_summary":"Maximal cliques in kG classified as T(v) or N(t); proving k-nullness remains open.","highlights":["G is K4-free so primal maximal cliques = facial triangles.","Link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle ⇒ interior deg≥4 and T(v) is a maximal clique in kG.","A fully interior face t yields N(t)={t plus its three opposite faces}, which induces a maximal K4 in kG.","Local Helly across an interior edge: any face meeting both incident faces must contain one endpoint; used in classification.","Shared-edge classification: any maximal clique containing two faces on an interior edge is T(u), T(v), or N(t)/N(g).","Three-triangle lemma: three pairwise-intersecting faces with no common vertex and no shared edge are exactly the three neighbors of a fully interior face (hence extend to N(t))."],"next_questions":["Formalize ear-removal induction for outerplanar (no-interior-vertex) triangulations to track maximal cliques under k and attempt to prove k-nullness.","Prove (or refute) that every Whitney disk triangulation is k-null by analysing k^2G/k^3G dynamics using the clique classification.","Exhaustively compute small Whitney disk triangulations (n≤20 faces, interior deg 4–5) to test stabilization patterns and search for counterexamples."]}

one_line_summary.description: Brief one-line summary for UI display
one_line_summary.title: One Line Summary
